description.narrative:
WARECOD will host the training in Vietnam planned from May 15th - 31st. There will be two components of the training:
i) The #standard# TOT workshop for the trainees followed by #on the job coaching# with a community based in Sapa. ii) The launch of a Vietnamesetranslation of one of Augusto Boal#s books. It is anticipated this will be of use to a wide range of practitioners working with communities and in education.
Outputs will be:
# The trainees will have learned new techniques and practicedthem with a target community # The translation into Vietnamese of one of Augusto Boal#s books will have made the techniques and approaches accessible to a Vietnamese audience # There will be video documentation of the process. Anticipated Project Benefits:
The water governance program isaddressing some of the most political sensitive development issues in the region i.e. impact on communities and their futures of water and energy management decisions, implications of land grabs and resettlement andthe role of the private sector. Forum Theatre methodology provides a creative and effective tool to mobilise and inform communities.
To date we have piloted these techniques with this facilitator through a partner and one full training week for youngpeople in Hanoi June 2015 . We have seen that it has considerable transformative impact and we know there is a demand amongst partners and stakeholders in the region. To some extent this is unexpected as the culture of societies in the region is far moreconservative than e.g. South America but the methodology appears to provide a means to express opinions and views that are outside normal hierarchies.
We have also seen that partners and young activistsexperience the Forum Theatre and then want to gooutand facilitate sessions themselves with little understanding that facilitation techniques require considerable training and knowledge. This has inherent risks given the political sensitivities in the region and we need to develop a cohort of trained facilitators.
The project builds on interest, seeks to secure sustainability through generating financial #buy in# from the primary target group (partners and associates) and leaving space for others to join the community. Itis anticipated that the promotion of Forum Theatre in the region and in water governance will lead to Oxfam interacting in different ways with established and new stakeholders. For example, DFAT is interested to promote the methodology with the Government of Lao PDR and World Bankpoverty alleviation program.
Being a visual medium that requires little verbal explanation, Forum Theatre presents potential fundraising opportunities that address the challenge of how to make consultation look interesting. It could be of interest to key supporters with creative backgrounds and there might be potential to make linkages with Australian arts and theatre.

participating-org.narrative:
WARECOD is a local Vietnamese NGO focusing on water resources management and conservation in 8 provinces in Northern Highland, Central Higland, and in Mekong delta. Warecod has 3 core programs: 1. research 2. Community development 3. Vietnam River Network (VRN)
WARECOD currently has 15 staff and 4 volunteers. For any area they start with research to go to community development. WARECOD has highly professional staff but may need some improvements/attention for organizational structure and functioning.
WARECOD has a lot of interest in a partnership with Oxfam given the important relationship in disaster preparedness and water management work and likesto start/ improve their ability for response in the areas they work.
WARECOD can contribute with # Water management/governance/CCA, for communities development and preparedness through capacity building # community based and policy influence based on that work (mainly at districts level) # river basin management # work with vulnerable ethnic minority communities
